subject: Re: [junit] Future of testing tools
msgSnippet: ... I m a bit confused where this discussion is going. If my class needs helper methods that it will be the only one using, I make them private on that same
messageBody:
On 2/20/07, Ole Ersoy <ole_ersoy@...> wrote:

> Or do it in reverse.
>
> Declare private methods on the Class, and have the
> builder create the ClassHelper.

I'm a bit confused where this discussion is going.

If my class needs helper methods that it will be the only one using, I
make them private on that same class (ideally, static private if they
don't modify any state).

Only if these helper methods can be useful to other classes would I
consider extracting them in a separate Helper class.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
